name: dactyl
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in poetry, a foot (= a unit of division of rhythm) with one strong or long syllable followed by two unstressed (= not strong) or short syllables: The title of the collection of poems was Jiggery-Pokery, which is a double dactyl. Dactyls are important in classical verse. Compare
anapest
iamb
spondee
trochee
More examplesFewer examplesWe can hear his voice sounding out the dactyls of "half a league, half a league onwards".Her name, Helena Shovelton, is a perfect double dactyl.The very name of Anna Karenina has a galloping rhythm, dactyls being commonly used for hoofbeats. The dactyls in line 114 contribute to the urgent, questioning tone.
